Since Dramatica is based on the mind's own problem-solving process, technically all movies that tried to argue something meaningful used Dramatica whether they knew it or not. No film will ever be an exact replication of a storyform because even at their best guess, Authors are only approximating.
As I understand it, that's something we would unlikely be able to know.
I would really enjoy watching movies that I know were created with Dramatica.
So, Arthur, introduced as a drunk, is Mind.

I would say it could be anything.  If he is physically addicted, it could be Situation.  If it disabled or enabled him physically, it could be Activity.  If he was driven to drink through a fixation, fear, or bias, then it would be Mind.  If drinking was a symptom of a psychological disorder, it would be Manipulation (Psychology).

For me, addiction isn't really the issue. More of a habit, or way of Arthur ignoring responsibility. So using Chris' points above, I'd say the MC domain is Physics/Activity (because Arthur is using the drink as a means to not take responsibility), therefore the OS domain being Psychology. I'm struggling to pin-point a story goal.

I think the story goal is to get Arthur married off to the socialite. It flirts with "making Arthur grow up / be responsible." I think this makes the Protagonist either his father or grandmother or both.

What I'm struggling with is how to describe the Physics throughline.
I think Arthur is Mind: ("Marry for love") and his caretaker is Situation (Cancer).
